title: Lost vintage peg and red dog lead at Vic Farm

posts.content:
Did anyone find an 'abandoned' red plastic coated steel dog rope and vintage tent peg near the top of the field?

We left it in the ground but well away from our camp so to all intents and purposes it could easily have been considered to be unwanted/abandoned.

The peg is what we want back the most, it is a special one for our vintage awning.

If you find it, please could you drop it off at the information point?

Thanks for any help.

Andrew

You want to speak to Tony busbug on here, he's quite a connoisseur on finding lost dog items. He found a Frisbee last year and had it posted back to the rightful owner.

He is a qualified private investigator by trade. Others on here will confirm, he really is a dick.
Hah didn't take you long give the guy his red lead back Tony are you still there???

Le Counte de JAYFOR wrote:Hah didn't take you long give the guy his red lead back Tony are you still there???


No Joe,been home a couple of hours,saw the post,had a drive round but couldn't find any thing this time,sorry.
Not enough info to go on case closed I'm afraid.
Tony C
Ps. Ring Eddie with exact location he might help out,or go to VW hang out in two weeks

Really appreciate you taking the time to go and look Tony, thanks. Thanks Joe for alerting our resident detective!


The peg/lead was not 'lost' as such, it was pegged in the ground behind our friend's Airstream and we know where it was to within a few feet.

It was still in the ground when our friends left the site at 10AM and had gone by the time we got back from Stanford Hall around 4.30PM. Given where the peg/lead was left, I truly believe that anyone seeing it would have rightly considered it abandoned - and Eddy would probably have appreciated not having to untangle it from his mower the next time he cuts the grass!

Just to reiterate, we'd really appreciate being reunited with this vintage peg (don't care about the lead) - the peg is 50+ years old and is part of the set originally shipped with our Airstream's vintage awning.

I wonder, are there folks here reading this who know others who would have been at Eddy's between those hours who may have innocently picked it up? I appreciate that not everyone reads these forums. We can't make Hangout but if it re-appears, perhaps Eddy could babysit it for us. Failing that, just leave it outside the big shiny Airstream thing - it gets to most south/midlands shows!
Best bet is to PM or even better phone Eddy, google Victoria farm for the number. Airstream looked great as always.
